intro: Hieracium melanothyrsum, commonly known as black-throated hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a dark central disk. It is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
